item.title: Angles of orthocentric simplices
item.description: arXiv:2505.05048v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: A $d$-dimensional simplex in Euclidean space is called orthocentric if all of its altitudes intersect at a single point, referred to as the orthocenter. We explicitly compute the internal and external angles at all faces of an orthocentric simplex. To this end, we introduce a parametric family of polyhedral cones, called orthocentric cones, and derive formulas for their angles and, more generally, for their conic intrinsic volumes. We characterize the tangent and normal cones of orthocentric simplices in terms of orthocentric cones with explicit parameters. Depending on whether the orthocenter lies inside the simplex, on its boundary, or outside, the simplex is classified as acute, rectangular, or obtuse, respectively. The solid angle formulas differ in these three cases. As a probabilistic application of the angle formulas, we explicitly compute the expected number of $k$-dimensional faces and the expected volume of the random polytope $[g_1/\tau_1, \ldots, g_n/\tau_n]$, where $g_1, \ldots, g_n$ are independent standard Gaussian vectors in $\mathbb{R}^d$, and $\tau_1, \ldots, \tau_n > 0$ are constants.
item.dc:creator: Zakhar Kabluchko, Philipp Schange

item.title: A fixed point theorem for the action of $SL_n$ over local fields on symmetric spaces of infinite dimension and finite rank
item.description: arXiv:2505.05220v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Let F be a non-archimedean local field, and let $G = SL_n(F)$, $n \ge 3$. Let $X$ be an infinite-dimensional simply connected symmetric space of finite rank, with nonpositive curvature operator. We prove that every continuous action by isometries of $G$ on $X$ has a fixed point.
item.dc:creator: Federico Viola

item.title: Square packings and rectifiable doubling measures
item.description: arXiv:2309.01283v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We prove that for all integers $2\leq m\leq d-1$, there exists doubling measures on $\mathbb{R}^d$ with full support that are $m$-rectifiable and purely $(m-1)$-unrectifiable in the sense of Federer (i.e. without assuming $\mu\ll\mathcal{H}^m$). The corresponding result for 1-rectifiable measures is originally due to Garnett, Killip, and Schul (2010). Our construction of higher-dimensional Lipschitz images is informed by a simple observation about square packing in the plane: $N$ axis-parallel squares of side length $s$ pack inside of a square of side length $\lceil N^{1/2}\rceil s$. The approach is robust and when combined with standard metric geometry techniques allows for constructions in complete Ahlfors regular metric spaces. One consequence of the main theorem is that for each $m\in\{2,3,4\}$ and $s<m$, there exist doubling measures $\mu$ on the Heisenberg group $\mathbb{H}^1$ and Lipschitz maps $f:E\subset\mathbb{R}^m\rightarrow\mathbb{H}^1$ such that $\mu\ll\mathcal{H}^{s-\epsilon}$ for all $\epsilon>0$, $f(E)$ has Hausdorff dimension $s$, and $\mu(f(E))>0$. This is striking, because $\mathcal{H}^m(f(E))=0$ for every Lipschitz map $f:E\subset\mathbb{R}^m\rightarrow\mathbb{H}^1$ by a theorem of Ambrosio and Kirchheim (2000). Another application of the square packing construction is that every compact metric space $\mathbb{X}$ of Assouad dimension strictly less than $m$ is a Lipschitz image of a compact set $E\subset[0,1]^m$. Of independent interest, we record the existence of doubling measures on complete Ahlfors regular metric spaces with prescribed lower and upper Hausdorff and packing dimensions.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Badger, Raanan Schul

item.title: Topological regularity of Busemann spaces of nonpositive curvature
item.description: arXiv:2504.14455v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We extend the topological results of Lytchak-Nagano and Lytchak-Nagano-Stadler for CAT(0) spaces to the setting of Busemann spaces of nonpositive curvature, i.e., BNPC spaces. We give a characterization of locally BNPC topological manifolds in terms of their links and show that the singular set of a locally BNPC homology manifold is discrete. We also prove that any (globally) BNPC topological 4-manifold is homeomorphic to Euclidean space. Applications include a topological stability theorem for locally BNPC G-spaces. Our arguments also apply to spaces admitting convex geodesic bicombings.
item.dc:creator: Tadashi Fujioka, Shijie Gu
